titleInfo.title: Détenu à la geôle de la paroisse St-Jean-Baptiste

subject.geographic: St. John the Baptist parish, La

mods.abstract: Détenu à la geôle de la paroisse St-Jean-Baptiste, les nègres: SANDER, CALVIN, WILLIS, TURNER, et CHARLES, tous les cinq disant appartenir à M. William Harper, de Natchez. Le propriétaire requis de réclamer ses esclaves conformément à la loi. U. JACOB, shériff. Paroisse St-Jean-Baptiste, 24 mai 1862. Detained in the Parish jail of St. John the Baptist the negroes: SANDERS, CALVIN, WILLIS, TURNER, and CHARLES, all saying they belong to Mr. Wm. Harper, of Nathez. The owner is requested to claim his property according to law. U. JACOB, sheriff. St. John the Baptist, May 24th, 1862.
mods.note: Louisiana State University Libraries, Special Collections ( http://www.lib.lsu.edu/special )
mods.accessCondition: E-mail lsudiglib@lsu.edu with questions or comments about the collection.

Physical rights are retained by the LSU Libraries. Copyright has expired and the item is therefore in the public domain. Permission to reproduce this image must be requested through the Special Collections Department, Louisiana State University Libraries.
mods.note: Louisiana Runaway Slave Advertisements, 1836-1865, Louisiana Digital Library, Baton Rouge, La.
